titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Ted Shawn and John Dougherty correspondence LSC.1859
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jasmine Larkin, 2022

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2023 March 3.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-03-10 16:29:59 -0800.

did.unittitle: Ted Shawn and John Dougherty correspondence
did.abstract: John Dougherty was one of the earliest students of Ted Shawn in the 1920s. He left the dance world in the 1930s and returned to it in 1955 as the Southern California Reporter for Dance Magazine, a post he kept for ten years. Dougherty established an intimate friendship with Ted Shawn which he maintained by way of voluminous correspondence and visits until Shawn's death. This collection consists of original letters from Ted Shawn to John Dougherty, and carbons of letters Dougherty wrote to Shawn, dated 1956 to 1971.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ted Shawn correspondence with John Dougherty (Collection 1859). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Dougherty was one of the earliest students of Ted Shawn in the 1920s. He left the dance world in the 1930s and returned to it in 1955 as the Southern California Reporter for Dance Magazine, a post he kept for ten years. He is well known for his many articles in that journal as well as in Dance News. In the 1960s, he took on the position of private secretary for Ruth St. Denis, a position he kept until her death in 1968. He transcribed hundreds of her letters, speeches and articles, many of which are important in the history of dance. In addition to this post, Dougherty established an intimate friendship with Ted Shawn which he maintained by way of voluminous correspondence and visits until Shawn's death in December, 1971. The letters are detailed about Shawn's life and his involvement in dance, and the Dougherty letters provide valuable information about Ruth St. Denis and her foundation in Los Angeles, for which Dougherty was the corresponding secretary. John Dougherty died in Los Angeles in April, 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of Ted Shawn typed and autograph letters to John Dougherty, and the carbon responses of Dougherty, 1956-1971.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection's arrangement maintains its existing order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: John Dougherty Papers (MS.P 003). Available at UC Irvine Special Collections.
Ruth St. Denis papers (LSC 1031). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.
